author: Staff Reporter
text:
Five persons died on the spot after a mini lorry ran amok and hit a parked lorry at Arasur near Ulundurpet in the district on Sunday. Three persons who were standing in front of the parked lorry and two others travelling in the mini lorry died.

The deceased have been identified as Subramaniam (52), his brother Muthukumaran (42) of Semmanandhal near Tirunavalur, Shanmugam (32) of Pattanam, and Suresh (35) and Sakthi (33) of Palakkad in Kerala, who were travelling in the mini lorry.

Police said that Subramaniam, Muthukumaran and Shanmugam were standing in front of the stationary lorry on Tiruchi-Chennai National Highway when the mini lorry carrying pigs rammed the vehicle at high speed, killing them on the spot.

The police said that the mini lorry was going from Guntur in Andhra Pradesh to Palakkad in Kerala. Suresh (35) and Sakthi (33), who were travelling in the mini lorry, also died on the spot.

Mini lorry driver Jayan and cleaner Mariappan sustained serious injuries and were rushed to Government Medical College and Hospital at Mundiyambakkam.

title: Five killed in accident
